ud8.8:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ud8.8:1.3: Now at that time the dear and beloved granddaughter of Visākhā Migāra’s Mother had just passed away.
ud8.8:1.4: Then, in the middle of the day, Visākhā with wet clothes and hair went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.
ud8.8:2.1: “So, Visākhā, where are you coming from in the middle of the day with wet clothes and hair?”
ud8.8:2.2: “Sir, my beloved granddaughter has just passed away.”
ud8.8:2.3: That’s why I here in the middle of the day with wet clothes and hair.”
ud8.8:2.4: “Visākhā, would you like as many children and grandchildren as there are people in the whole of Sāvatthī?”
ud8.8:3.1: “But Visākhā, how many people pass away each day in Sāvatthī?”
ud8.8:3.11: or at least one person who passes away every day in Sāvatthī.
ud8.8:3.12: Sāvatthī is never without someone passing away.”
ud8.8:4.1: “What do you think, Visākhā? Would there ever be a time when your clothes and hair were not wet?”
